TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit ConfigurationSectionCollection extends System.Collections.Specialized.NameObjectCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of related sections within a configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ConfigurationSectionCollection class to iterate through a collection of <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> objects. You can access this collection of objects using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Sections%2A> property or the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionGroup.Sections%2A> property.
The ConfigurationSectionCollection class is also used in the creation of custom types that extend the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection> class.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the ConfigurationSectionCollection class.
[!CODE [System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionCollection#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.ConfigurationSectionCollection#1)]
The following example is an excerpt of the configuration file used by the previous example.
``` <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <configuration> <configSections>
<section name="CustomSection" type="Samples.AspNet.Configuration.CustomSection, ConfigurationSectionCollection, Version=1.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" allowDefinition="Everywhere" allowExeDefinition="MachineToApplication" restartOnExternalChanges="true" />
</configSections>
<CustomSection fileName="default.txt" maxUsers="1000" maxIdleTime="00:05:00" />
</configuration> ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetObjectData method is used during serialization; that is, when persisting configuration data to a configuration file.
